result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne W Bornick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Negligent Use/Weapon/Explosive, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10/17/17 Probation is extended for 2 yr from 1/6/18 to 1/6/20, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.
10/24/17 Probation is extended for 2 yrs from 1/8/18 to 1/8/20, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: $518  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AB.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

4/26/16 Crt signed order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Status conference at 11-02-2015 01:30 pm

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Angela B.
- Defendant shall not be on Lori Cir in Masdison, WI.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall surrender his AK-47 and any other firearms to law enforcement by the close of business today.
- Defendant shall surrender his concealed carry (CCW) permit to law enforcement or the Dane County Clerk of Courts by the close of business today.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 15

Defendant appeared.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
